docs.snippet: The United Nations General Assembly, meeting in plenary session at Flushing Meadow, decided yesterday to open and close its deliberations with a minute of silence devoted to prayer and meditation.
docs.lead_paragraph: The United Nations General Assembly, meeting in plenary session at Flushing Meadow, decided yesterday to open and close its deliberations with a minute of silence devoted to prayer and meditation.
docs.abstract: Assembly approves 1 min of silence at opening and end of sessions

headline.main: ASSEMBLY AGREES ON PRAYER PERIOD; Plan for a Minute of Silence at Opening and Close of U. N. Session Is Voted

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES -- October, November and December north of the equator mean April, May and June below it. Which is another way of saying that the best of the South American season is at hand, particularly for voyagers who yearn for Rio and beyond.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES -- October, November and December north of the equator mean April, May and June below it. Which is another way of saying that the best of the South American season is at hand, particularly for voyagers who yearn for Rio and beyond.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 29 -- The long-standing split between the State Department and the Economic Cooperation Administration over policy toward Argentina has been emphasized by a deal in which the purchase of 1,500 tons of meat in Mexico for Greece has...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 29 -- The long-standing split between the State Department and the Economic Cooperation Administration over policy toward Argentina has been emphasized by a deal in which the purchase of 1,500 tons of meat in Mexico for Greece has been authorized despite the fact that Argentina was acknowledged to have made the lowest bid.
docs.abstract: Argentina angered over ECA purchase of 1,500 tons from Mex despite low Argentine bid; Dr D A FitzGerald comment

headline.main: ARGENTINES IRKED BY. E.C.A. MEAT DEAL; 1,500-Ton Purchase in Mexico for Greece Despite Lower Buenos Aires Bid Is Cited

docs.snippet: Very little stirred in the foreign exchange market last week, business being light and price changes unimportant. The recent wave of currency revaluations aside from producing these results has gone far in eliminating the nervousness which the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Very little stirred in the foreign exchange market last week, business being light and price changes unimportant. The recent wave of currency revaluations aside from producing these results has gone far in eliminating the nervousness which the trading fraternity faced as the week-end approached with its potential and "dreadful possibilities" ahead. Succinctly, the Friday-jitters are no more.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Oct. 28, 1949.

docs.snippet: Foote, Cone  Belding International has completed the first phase of expansion in Latin America, it was announced yesterday by Luis G. Dillon, executive vice president in charge of the operations. FCBI now has twelve Latin-American agencies associated...
docs.lead_paragraph: Foote, Cone Belding International has completed the first phase of expansion in Latin America, it was announced yesterday by Luis G. Dillon, executive vice president in charge of the operations. FCBI now has twelve Latin-American agencies associated with it, in addition to services of its own regional directors and other personnel.
